item.title: Renee add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "The beginning is the word and the end is silence. And in between are all the stories." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Renee add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Renee add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Renee add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "He couldn’t see why people made such a fuss about people eating their silly old fruit anyway, but life would be a lot less fun if they didn’t. And there was never an apple, in Adam’s opinion, that wasn’t worth the trouble you got into for eating it." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Renee add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And for a moment, I understand that I have friends on this lonely path; that sometimes your place is not something you find, but something you have when you need it." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Renee add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Why do cats sleep so much? Perhaps they've been trusted with some major cosmic task, an essential law of physics - such as: if there are less than 5 million cats sleeping at any one time the world will stop spinning. So that when you look at them and think, "what a lazy, good-for-nothing animal," they are, in fact, working very, very hard." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Renee add a quote by Anya Seton
item.description: "Truth is naturally universal...and shines into many different windows, though many are clouded." -- Anya Seton

item.title: Renee add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Renee add a quote by Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is possibly worth mentioning at this point that Mr. Young thought that paparazzi was a kind of Italian linoleum." -- Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett

item.title: Renee add a quote by Zeno of Citium, as quoted by Diogenes Laërtius
item.description: "We have two ears and one mouth, so we should listen more than we say." -- Zeno of Citium, as quoted by Diogenes Laërtius

item.title: Renee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Renee add a quote by Germaine Greer
item.description:
"Libraries are reservoirs of strength, grace and wit, reminders of order, calm and continuity, lakes of mental energy, neither warm nor cold, light nor dark ... In any library in the world, I am at home, unselfconscious, still and absorbed."
[<i>Still in Melbourne January 1987</i>]" -- Germaine Greer

item.title: Renee add a quote by Guy Gavriel Kay
item.description: "There are no wrong turnings. Only paths we had not known we were meant to walk." -- Guy Gavriel Kay

item.title: Renee add a quote by Martin Niemöller
Renee add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Renee add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't go back to yesterday because I was a different person then." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Renee add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Renee add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Death's got an Invisibility Cloak?" Harry interrupted again. "So he can sneak up on people," said Ron. "Sometimes he gets bored of running at them, flapping his arms and shrieking..." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Renee add a quote by Daniel H. Pink
item.description: "The ultimate freedom for creative groups is the freedom to experiment with new ideas. Some skeptics insist that innovation is expensive. In the long run, innovation is cheap. Mediocrity is expensive—and autonomy can be the antidote.” TOM KELLEY General Manager, IDEO" -- Daniel H. Pink

item.title: Renee add a quote by Daniel H. Pink
item.description: "Human beings have an innate inner drive to be autonomous, self-determined, and connected to one another. And when that drive is liberated, people achieve more and live richer lives." -- Daniel H. Pink

item.title: Renee add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Renee add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "If people sat outside and looked at the stars each night, I'll bet they'd live a lot differently. " -- Bill Watterson
